* Loads all previously saved inputs from the data file.

* Checks if there is existing data in the storage file.
* @return true if the data file exists and is not empty
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* @param input the description and deadline in the format "desc /by yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" or "desc /by yyyy-MM-dd"
* Returns the string representation of the deadline task.
* @return formatted string showing description and deadline
DateTimeFormatter oFormat = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy, h:mm a");
* Represents a task with a start and end date/time (event).
* @param input the description and time in the format
*              or with dates only "desc /from yyyy-MM-dd /to yyyy-MM-dd"
* Returns the string representation of the event task.
* @return formatted string showing description, start and end times
DateTimeFormatter oFormat = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy, h:mm a");
* Represents a general task in the Duke application.
* This is the parent class for all specific task types.
* Creates a new task with the given description.
* Marks the task as not completed.
* Returns the status icon representing whether the task is done.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* Manages a list of tasks in the Duke application.
private static final ArrayList<Task> lst = new ArrayList<>();
* Adds a task to the list.
* Removes a task from the list.
* @param i the index (1-based) of the task to remove
* Marks a task in the list as completed.
* @param i the index (1-based) of the task to mark done
* Marks a task in the list as not completed.
* @param i the index (1-based) of the task to mark undone
* Returns the task at the given index.
* @param i the index (0-based) of the task
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Displays all the tasks in the list.
System.out.println("     Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Finds and displays tasks that match the given keyword.
System.out.println("     Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Represents a task without any date/time (a simple todo).
* @param input the description of the task
* Returns the string representation of the todo task.
* @return formatted string with task type and description
* Represents exceptions that occur in the Duke bot.
* Creates a new BotException with the given message.
* Utility class for printing error messages in a formatted style.
* Prints an error message in a formatted box.
* @param msg the error message to display
* Parser class to interpret user inputs into commands.
* @param hasReadBack indicates if current inputs should be echoed back to the user
* Parses a user input string and executes the corresponding command.
* @return true if Duke should continue running, false if it should exit
* Enables readback so that commands are echoed back to the user.
* UI class to handle interactions with the user.
System.out.println("     Hello! I'm\n" + logo + "\n" + "     What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("     Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("     Now you have " + Tasklist.listSize() + " tasks in the list");
System.out.println("    Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println("     Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("     Now you have " + Tasklist.listSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* @param i index of task marked as done
System.out.println("     Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* @param i index of task marked as not done
System.out.println("     OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
throw new BotException("OOPS!!! Mark needs a task number.");
throw new BotException("OOPS!!! Unmark needs a task number.");
throw new BotException("OOPS!!! Delete needs a task number.");
throw new BotException("OOPS!!! The description of a Todo cannot be empty.");
throw new BotException("OOPS!!! The description of a Deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new BotException("OOPS!!! The description of an Event cannot be empty.");
throw new BotException("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
